Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is no "baby." This bold, rich Cabernet Sauvignon-driven blend has grown-up elegance, from its aromas of dewberries, dark raspberries, saline and rose petals, to its Mikhail Baryshnikov-like balance. In between, look for flavors like blackberry fruit jellies, thyme and dark chocolate.                      Michael Alberty
Name: Pursued by Bear 2019 Bear Cub Red (Columbia Valley (WA))Editors' Choice

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a winning Super Tuscan blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, starting with the pleasantly reserved aromas of roasted strawberry on the subtle nose. The palate adds caramel dust and oak spice to that red fruit core, making for a very versatile bottling.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Le Vigne 2019 Patria Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lush aromas of raspberry jam and licorice dust show on the nose of this blend of 61% Syrah, 30% Graciano and 9% Grenache. Fresh purple and red flower flavors pop on the palate alongside juicy raspberry and blueberry elements, as the young tannins give a sticky edge.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Piazza Family 2020 Nancy's Cuvee Red (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc unite to create a flavorful wine with a lithe body, smooth tannins and pucker-worthy acidity. Aromas of blackberries, orange peel and fir needles are followed by Arnold Palmer-like flavors of raspberries, lemonade and black tea. This is delicious stuff.                      Michael Alberty
Name: Gramercy 2019 Estates Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Cabernet Franc-driven estate blend spent 18 months in 100% new French oak. Bright, fresh aromas of mulberries and citrus are followed by notes of dried fig. A sweet blackberry flavor dominates the palate, joined by orange slices and wet rocks. Silky tannins and a juicy mouthfeel.                      Michael Alberty
Name: Col Solare 2019 Collector's Society Red Wine Red (Red Mountain)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Created by assistant winemaker Jackson Dwelley, this blend of 70% Tempranillo and 30% Grenache is a wise combination for this terroir. Aromas of dried cherry, fennel pollen and cola drop into a palate of baked berry and minty sage.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hungry Hawk 2020 Jackson's Blend Red (San Diego County)
